title: extension
content:
---

    1. üêö Final `build.sh`

```bash

  1. !/bin/sh

<a title="Install raindrop-io Raycast Extension" href="https://www.raycast.com/lardissone/raindrop-io"></a>

  1. Install Raindrop.io Raycast Extension

EXT_NAME="premium-access-theme-switcher" BUILD_DIR="build"

echo "Cleaning old build..." rm -rf "$BUILD_DIR" mkdir "$BUILD_DIR"

echo "Copying extension files..." cp manifest.json README.md build.sh content-script.js background.js config.json preview.json popup.html popup.css popup.js "$BUILD_DIR" cp -r icons "$BUILD_DIR/icons"

echo "Creating ZIP package..." cd "$BUILD_DIR" zip -r "../$EXT_NAME.zip" .

echo "‚úÖ Build complete: $EXT_NAME.zip"

title: Refresh Option
content:
This may sound really stupid to some but I get really ticked that the 'refresh' arrow is so far away from the URL. I have to use my trackpad to do this and it's a pain to have to go so far. Every other browser has it right next to the address bar. It may sound lazy but I'm 70, have arthritis and try not to overuse the track pad. Harumph!

As you can see Chrome has it right next to the address bar while Safari's is contained right in it. A simple thing but it can make all the difference. Does it but anyone else?
creator: wendyjones2613
